products.name: deploy-arch-ibm-mq-cloud
products.label: Cloud automation for MQ on Cloud
products.short_description: Cloud architecture including an MQ on Cloud instance and optional security, logging, and notification services.
products.long_description:
[IBM MQ](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/mqcloud/index.html) is an end-to-end solution for building and running secure queue managers. It connects applications dynamically, securely, and reliably across your messaging network, so your business can build message-driven and event-driven applications at scale.
This deployable architecture creates an instance of IBM MQ along with optional security and observability cloud services.

ℹ️ This deployable architecture is a part of a larger collection that IBM provides. Each deployable architecture focuses on a single IBM Cloud service. You can use these deployable architectures on their own to automate deployments by following an [IaC approach](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/secure-enterprise?topic=secure-enterprise-understanding-projects), or you can [combine them together](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/secure-enterprise?topic=secure-enterprise-config-stack) to deploy a more complex end-to-end solution architecture.

features.title: Creates an IBM MQ instance
features.description: Get started with IBM MQ by creating an instance. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/apidocs/mq-on-cloud).

features.title: Securely manage secrets
features.description: You can optionally deploy [Cloud automation for Secrets Manager](https://cloud.ibm.com/catalog/7a4d68b4-cf8b-40cd-a3d1-f49aff526eb3/architecture/deploy-arch-ibm-secrets-manager-6d6ebc76-7bbd-42f5-8bc7-78f4fabd5944-global) to centrally manage TLS certificates that are required by IBM MQ.

features.title: Sets up logging for the IBM MQ instance
features.description: Optionally, you can deploy Cloud automation for Cloud Logs to route, alert, and visualize platform logs that are generated by your IBM MQ instance.[Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/mqcloud?topic=mqcloud-logging)

features.title: Sets up monitoring operational metrics for the IBM MQ instance
features.description: Optionally, you can deploy Cloud automation for Cloud Monitoring to measure how users and applications interact with your IBM MQ instance. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/mqcloud?topic=mqcloud-monitor_sysdig)

features.title: Sets up activity tracking for the IBM MQ instance
features.description: Optionally, you can deploy Cloud automation for Activity Tracker Event Routing to route and securely store auditing events that are related to your IBM MQ instance. [Lear more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/mqcloud?topic=mqcloud-at_events)

products.support_details: This product is in the community registry, as such support is handled through the [original repo](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-mq-cloud). If you experience issues kindly open an issue in that repository [here](https://github.com/terraform-ibm-modules/terraform-ibm-mq-cloud/issues). Please note that this product is not currently supported through the IBM Cloud Support Center.

iam_permissions.notes: Required to provision and manage IBM MQ.
[Optional] Required to create a Secrets Manager instance.
[Optional] Required to create an Event Notifications instance.
[Optional] Required to create an instance of Cloud Monitoring.
[Optional] Required to create an instance of Cloud Logs.
[Optional] Required if IBM Hyper Protect Crypto Services is used for key encryption.
[Optional] Required if Key Protect is used for key encryption.
[Optional] Required to set up Activity Tracker Event Routing to audit events.

[Optional] Required to deploy Cloud automation for account configuration, which creates foundational IBM Cloud account resources, like IAM settings, trusted profiles, access groups, and resource groups.

iam_permissions.service_name: All Identity and Access enabled services
iam_permissions.notes: [Optional] Required to deploy Cloud automation for account configuration, which creates foundational IBM Cloud account resources, like IAM settings, trusted profiles, access groups, and resource group with account settings.
Required to create an instance of IBM MQ.
[Optional] Required to create an Object Storage instance.

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-secrets-manager
dependencies.description: Configure Secrets Manager to centrally manage TLS certificates.

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-cloud-logs
dependencies.description: Configure an IBM Cloud Logs instance to analyze platform logs.

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-cloud-monitoring
dependencies.description: Configure IBM Cloud Monitoring to collect platform metrics.

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-activity-tracker
dependencies.description: Configure Activity Tracker Event Routing to route auditing events.

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-account-infra-base
dependencies.description: Cloud automation for account configuration organizes your IBM Cloud account with a ready-made set of resource groups by default. And, when you enable the “with Account Settings” option, it also applies baseline security and governance settings.

dependencies.name: deploy-arch-ibm-scc-workload-protection
dependencies.description: Configure an IBM Cloud Security and Compliance Center Workload Protection instance to help you manage security and compliance for your organization.

configuration.description: When set to `true`, the IBM Cloud Monitoring instance is configured to collect platform metrics from the specified region. You can configure only one instance of the IBM Cloud Monitoring service per region to collect platform metrics in that location. Check with the account or service administrator if another monitoring instance is already configured. You might not have permissions to see all monitoring instances in the region. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/monitoring?topic=monitoring-platform_metrics_enabling).

To manage platform logs that are generated by IBM Cloud services in a region of IBM Cloud, you must create a tenant in each region that you operate. Pass a list of regions to create a tenant in. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/logs-router?topic=logs-router-about-platform-logs).
The region where the Secrets Manager instance is provisioned.

The pricing plan to use to provision a Secrets Manager instance. Possible values are `standard` or `trial`. You can create only one Trial instance of Secrets Manager per account. Before you can create a Trial instance, you must delete the existing Trial instance and its reclamation. [Learn more](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/secrets-manager?topic=secrets-manager-create-instance&interface=ui#upgrade-instance-standard).

features.description: Configured to use IBM secure-by-default standards, but you can edit it to fit your use case.

diagrams.description:
This deployable architecture creates an instance of IBM MQ on Cloud, providing a secure, scalable, and fully managed messaging service for applications. After you deploy this solution, you can access the IBM MQ dashboard to create and configure queue managers, manage message queues, and integrate them into your applications by using industry-standard messaging protocols.

Optionally, you can deploy Secrets Manager to securely store and manage TLS certificates and other sensitive credentials that IBM MQ requires. By doing so, you help ensure secure connectivity and compliance.

You can also enable observability services such as Cloud Monitoring, Cloud Logs, and Activity Tracker Event Routing to gain operational visibility into your IBM MQ workloads. These capabilities allow you to collect and analyze metrics such as CPU and memory usage, track user and application interactions, and monitor platform logs for troubleshooting and audit purposes.
